questions.question: What is the Association of Effective Governance’s goal?
questions.answer: We believe in the power of well-informed policies for bringing change in our society. We aim to reduce the gap amongst policy-makers, civil society organizations and academia. We want to create a space which allows smooth flow of data and information on policy agendas and allows CSOs & academia to access the corridors of policy-making. The MPs associated with us also stand a chance to efficiently engage with the relevant stakeholders of a problem statement and make policies which look good not only on paper but also in action.

questions.question: What does a ‘Parliamentarians’ Group for Advocacy’ do?
questions.answer: Parliamentarians Group for Advocacy is a platform where civil society organizations, Members of Parliament and community come together for a cause to discuss, and deliberate over specifics and draft a policy memo to present to the relevant government agencies and organizations

questions.question: How do we decide which causes to take up for Parliamentarians Groups for Advocacy?
questions.answer: We take up relevant causes that are backed by the belief and resources of the engaging  civil society organizations, Members of Parliament, and community members.

questions.question: What is the role of AEG India in a PGA?
questions.answer: Association of Effective Governance is an enabler of the platform where stakeholders come together to draft policy memos. AEG essentially has a ‘supporting role’ for meetings, events, and research for policy initiatives. All initiatives need a great leader to be successful in their goals. We provide a convener for every Parliamentary Group of Advocacy who will help in coordination between the participating parties and direct the flow of the group.

questions.question: What is the role of Members of Parliament in a PGA?
questions.answer: Members of Parliament bring to the table their extensive experience in the policy arena. They possess a nuanced understanding of the policy making procedures. MPs back the policy memos drafted by the Parliamentarians Group for Advocacy with their political capital and provide an impetus to the policy initiatives under PGAs

questions.question: What are policy initiatives?
questions.answer: We believe in starting a movement for our cause and hence, the policy initiatives. Policy initiatives are the causes we believe in. Roundtables, conferences and community awareness programs are one of the aspects of policy initiatives. We seek to identify pain-points of the society in a broader issue through the initiative to draft policy documents known as policy memos to solve the pain-points. Drafting policy memos is one aspect, which is followed up by starting conversations around the cause.

questions.question: Is there any active Parliamentarians Group for Advocacy?
questions.answer: Yes, Parliamentarians Group for Climate Action is currently active whereby a policy initiative with regards to Particulate Matter (PM) emissions from diesel generators is under-way. To read more about the initiative, click here.

questions.question: As a civil society organization, how can I take part in a Parliamentarians Group for Advocacy?
questions.answer: You can take part in meetings with MPs highlighting your standpoint as a representative of particular stakeholders in the society, take part in the drafting of policy memos for the policy initiatives and engage in dialogue and discussion in our awareness and mobilization programs

questions.question: I represent a civil society organization. I want to initiate a PGA for a cause. How should I go about it?
questions.answer: If you want us to take up PGA on a cause, hit us up with your belief in a cause by contacting us at info@aegindia.in  If we are collectively able to generate enough resources, social and political backing, a new Parliamentarians Groups for Advocacy will be formed.

questions.question: How can you support us?
questions.answer: You can support us by sponsoring our round table discussions, conferences, etc., and providing support to our research efforts.

questions.question: Is there any particular eligibility criteria for applying to the internship program?
questions.answer: Yes, the applicant must at least be pursuing a graduate degree from a renowned College or University. To aid your transition to work with a MP Office, we will be conducting a week long training session to equip you with better skills for the job.

questions.question: How do I apply for the program?
questions.answer: We usually start to look for applications 45 days before the Parliament session is scheduled to begin. You can follow us on our social media pages to keep track of the updates.

questions.question: Do I get to choose which MP Office I want to work with?
questions.answer: All decisions regarding the attachment of an intern to any MP Office is taken by AEG India after deliberation with the MP. The intern will be communicated about the details after being selected for the program.

questions.question: What is the time period of the internship program?
questions.answer: The internship will usually begin 30 days before the scheduled commencement of the Parliamentary session & goes on until the end of that particular session.

questions.question: What is the expected timeline of the product launch?
questions.answer: We are currently working on developing the product. We expect it to be ready for launch by the end of the year 2020
